{ "title": "Technical SEO Services", "slug": "technical-seo", "parent": 12, "status": "publish", "content": "

Technical SEO Services That Fix What's Holding You Back

Your website could be perfect for customers ‚Äî but if Google can't crawl it, index it, or understand it, you're invisible. Our technical SEO services eliminate the barriers holding your site back from ranking.

Trust Signals: Avg. 247% organic traffic increase | 98% Core Web Vitals pass rate | 100+ sites optimized

What Is Technical SEO and Why It Matters

Technical SEO is the foundation of your website's ability to rank. It's the behind-the-scenes optimization that ensures Google can discover, crawl, understand, and rank your content.

Think of it this way: Content is what you say. Technical SEO is making sure search engines can hear you.

Technical SEO Ensures:

Google can CRAWL your site efficiently

  • No robots.txt blocking important pages
  • Clean XML sitemaps guiding crawlers
  • No redirect chains wasting crawl budget
  • JavaScript rendering handled correctly

Google can INDEX your pages correctly

  • No duplicate content issues
  • Canonical tags preventing index bloat
  • No technical errors blocking indexation
  • Pages structured for easy understanding

Google can UNDERSTAND your content

  • Schema markup explaining what everything is
  • Clear site architecture showing relationships
  • Internal linking distributing authority
  • Structured data for rich results

Your site LOADS FAST

  • Core Web Vitals passing (LCP, FID, CLS)
  • Images optimized and lazy-loaded
  • Server response times under 600ms
  • Critical rendering path optimized

Your site is MOBILE-FRIENDLY

  • Responsive design
  • Touch targets sized correctly
  • Viewport configured properly
  • Mobile-first indexing compliance

Your site is SECURE

  • HTTPS implemented correctly
  • No mixed content warnings
  • Security headers in place
  • No malware or hacks

The Problem

You can have the best content in the world ‚Äî compelling, keyword-optimized, perfectly written for your audience. But if your site has technical issues, Google won't rank you.

Common technical problems we fix:

  • Site loads in 8 seconds (should be under 2.5s)
  • Only 200 of your 2,000 pages are indexed
  • Google can't crawl pages behind JavaScript
  • Duplicate content across 15 different URLs
  • No schema markup (Google is guessing what you do)
  • Mobile version is broken (75% of searches are mobile)
  • SSL certificate expired (instant ranking penalty)

The opportunity: Most of your competitors have technical SEO problems they don't know about. Fixing them gives you an immediate competitive advantage.

What's Included in Our Technical SEO Services

We audit and optimize every technical factor Google uses to evaluate your site.

1. Core Web Vitals Optimization

Core Web Vitals are Google's user experience metrics ‚Äî and they're a confirmed ranking factor. Sites that pass all three metrics rank higher and retain visitors better.

The Three Core Web Vitals:

  • LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) ‚Äî Loading Performance. Target: < 2.5 seconds
  • FID (First Input Delay) ‚Äî Interactivity. Target: < 100 milliseconds
  • CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift) ‚Äî Visual Stability. Target: < 0.1

Why It Matters: Passing Core Web Vitals = higher rankings + lower bounce rates + more conversions. A 1-second delay in load time can reduce conversions by 7%.

Target: 98%+ of pages passing all three metrics

2. Crawlability & Indexation Audit

If Google can't crawl your pages, they can't rank. We ensure every important page is discoverable and no crawl budget is wasted.

What we audit:

  • Robots.txt optimization
  • XML Sitemaps (clean, organized, prioritized)
  • Crawl Budget Optimization (remove crawl waste)
  • JavaScript Rendering (ensure Google can see dynamic content)
  • Orphan Pages (find and link unindexed pages)
  • Log File Analysis (what Googlebot is actually crawling)

Why It Matters: Crawlability is prerequisite to ranking. If Google isn't finding your pages, your important content never gets indexed.

3. Schema Markup Implementation

Schema is structured data that helps Google understand your business, services, and content. It's speaking Google's native language.

Schema Types We Implement:

  • LocalBusiness Schema (NAP, hours, geo-coordinates)
  • Organization Schema (brand identity signals)
  • Service Schema (each service offering)
  • Product Schema (for e-commerce)
  • Review/AggregateRating Schema (star ratings)
  • FAQ Schema (featured snippet opportunities)
  • Article Schema (blog posts and content)
  • Breadcrumb Schema (navigation structure)

Why It Matters: Schema increases rich result opportunities and helps Google understand context. Sites with proper schema get more SERP real estate.

4. Site Architecture & Internal Linking

Your site structure determines how PageRank flows and how Google understands your content hierarchy.

What we optimize:

  • Information Architecture (logical category structure)
  • URL Structure (clean, keyword-rich)
  • Internal Linking Strategy (hub-and-spoke model)
  • Siloing for Topical Authority
  • Canonical Tag Implementation
  • Noindex/Nofollow Strategic Deployment

Why It Matters: Strategic architecture and internal linking boost rankings for priority pages. Google follows links to discover content and distributes authority through your link graph.

5. Mobile Optimization & Responsive Design

Google uses mobile-first indexing ‚Äî your mobile site IS your primary site. If it's not optimized, you won't rank.

What we audit:

  • Mobile-First Indexing Compliance
  • Viewport Configuration
  • Touch Target Sizing (minimum 48√ó48px)
  • Mobile Usability Errors
  • Responsive Design

Why It Matters: Mobile-first indexing means if your mobile site has issues, your rankings suffer ‚Äî even on desktop searches.

6. Site Speed Optimization

Site speed is a ranking factor AND a conversion factor. Faster sites rank higher and convert better.

What we optimize:

  • Image Optimization (WebP format, lazy loading)
  • CSS/JavaScript Optimization (minify, defer)
  • Browser Caching (leverage caching headers)
  • CDN Implementation (Cloudflare or similar)
  • Database Optimization
  • Critical Rendering Path
  • Third-Party Script Audit

Target: LCP < 2.5s | Total page load < 3s | PageSpeed Insights 90+

7. HTTPS & Security

HTTPS is a ranking signal. Unsecure sites are penalized and flagged in browsers.

What we implement:

  • SSL Certificate (install and renewal)
  • Mixed Content Fixes
  • Security Headers (HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options)
  • Malware/Hack Recovery
  • Security Monitoring

8. Duplicate Content & Canonicalization

Duplicate content dilutes ranking signals. Google doesn't know which version to rank, so often none rank well.

What we fix:

  • Internal duplicates audit
  • Canonical Tag Strategy
  • Parameter Handling
  • Pagination
  • Syndication Management

How Our Technical SEO Process Works

Phase 1: Comprehensive Technical Audit (Week 1)

We crawl your entire site using enterprise tools and analyze every technical factor. Deliverable: Technical SEO Audit Report (50-100 pages) with prioritized issues categorized by Critical, High, Medium, and Low impact.

Phase 2: Prioritization & Roadmap (Week 1-2)

We score every issue and build a phased implementation plan with Tier 1 (Critical Fixes), Tier 2 (High-Impact), Tier 3 (Foundation Building), and Tier 4 (Monitoring & Maintenance).

Phase 3: Implementation & Testing

We implement fixes in staging, test thoroughly, then deploy to production with a comprehensive testing protocol.

Phase 4: Reporting & Continuous Improvement

Monthly reports with Core Web Vitals trends, indexation changes, schema error monitoring, and quarterly deep-dives with competitive analysis.

Why LocalCatalyst Technical SEO Gets Results

1. We Don't Just Find Issues ‚Äî We Fix Them

Many agencies deliver 100-page audit reports and disappear. We implement the fixes, test them, and monitor results.

2. We Optimize for AI Visibility, Not Just Google

We prepare your technical foundation for LLM crawlers and AI-generated answers ‚Äî the future of search in 2026.

3. We Use Enterprise Tools, Agency Pricing

Our audits use enterprise-level tools (Screaming Frog, Sitebulb, Ahrefs) without enterprise-level costs.

4. Local + Technical Integration

We integrate technical SEO with local SEO strategy: LocalBusiness schema, multi-location architecture, GBP-website synchronization.

Technical SEO Pricing

One-Time Technical SEO Audit ‚Äî $2,500

Complete site crawl, Core Web Vitals analysis, schema audit, crawlability report, prioritized action plan. Deliverable: 50-100 page audit report. Timeline: 7-10 days.

Technical SEO Implementation ‚Äî Starting at $4,500

Everything in Audit plus implementation of Tier 1 and Tier 2 fixes, schema deployment, optimization testing. Timeline: 4-8 weeks.

Ongoing Technical SEO Management ‚Äî $1,500/month

Quarterly crawls, monthly Core Web Vitals monitoring, schema error fixes, new page optimization, Google Search Console monitoring.

Technical SEO Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What's the difference between technical SEO and on-page SEO?
A: Technical SEO focuses on site infrastructure (speed, crawlability, schema, mobile-friendliness). On-page SEO focuses on content (titles, headings, keywords). Both are necessary.

Q: How long does a technical SEO audit take?
A: For sites under 10,000 pages, we deliver audits within 7-10 days.

Q: Can you fix technical issues on any CMS?
A: Yes. We work with WordPress, Shopify, Webflow, custom-built sites, and enterprise platforms.

Q: Will fixing technical SEO improve my rankings immediately?
A: Critical fixes can show impact within days to weeks. Core Web Vitals improvements typically show within 4-8 weeks as Google re-crawls.

Q: Do I need technical SEO if my site is new?
A: Absolutely. It's easier and cheaper to build it right from the start than to fix it later.

Ready to Fix What's Holding Your Site Back?

Get a free technical SEO audit and discover exactly what's preventing your site from ranking.

Get Your Free Technical SEO Audit

{ "title": "On-Page Optimization", "slug": "on-page-optimization", "parent": 12, "status": "publish", "content": "

On-Page SEO Services That Turn Content Into Rankings

Great content doesn't rank by accident. Our on-page SEO services optimize every element ‚Äî from title tags to internal linking ‚Äî to make your content irresistible to both Google and customers.

Trust Signals: Avg. 178% organic traffic increase | 92% keyword ranking improvement | 100+ sites optimized

What Is On-Page SEO and Why It Matters

On-page SEO (also called on-page optimization or on-site SEO) is the practice of optimizing individual web pages to rank higher and earn more relevant traffic. It tells Google exactly what your page is about.

On-page SEO includes three core components:

Content Optimization: Keyword research, content quality, semantic keywords, content freshness

HTML Optimization: Title tags, meta descriptions, header tags, image alt text, URL structure

User Experience Optimization: Internal linking, content formatting, CTAs, multimedia

Why It Matters: Without proper on-page SEO, even the best content sits invisible on page 10. It's the difference between content that ranks and content that doesn't.

What's Included in Our On-Page SEO Services

1. Keyword Research & Targeting Strategy

What We Do: Comprehensive keyword research, competitor gap analysis, keyword intent mapping, primary/secondary keyword assignment, LSI keyword identification

Deliverable: Keyword targeting matrix for your entire site

Why It Matters: Targeting the right keywords is the difference between traffic that converts and traffic that bounces.

2. Title Tag Optimization

What We Do: Rewrite all title tags, front-load primary keywords, strategic brand positioning, character length optimization (50-60 chars), CTR optimization with power words

Why It Matters: Title tags are the #1 on-page ranking factor and the first thing users see. A well-optimized title can increase CTR by 30-50%.

3. Meta Description Optimization

What We Do: Write compelling meta descriptions (150-160 chars), include keywords naturally, add clear CTAs, create unique descriptions for every page

Why It Matters: Meta descriptions affect CTR dramatically ‚Äî which DOES affect rankings.

4. Header Tag Optimization (H1-H6)

What We Do: Strategic H1 placement (one per page), logical H2/H3 hierarchy, keyword-rich subheadings, scannability optimization

Why It Matters: Headers signal content structure to search engines and dramatically improve readability. Proper headers can increase time-on-page by 25%+.

5. Content Optimization & Expansion

What We Do: Evaluate content quality and depth, expand thin content, add semantic keywords naturally, improve readability, integrate multimedia, update outdated content, add FAQ sections

Content Quality Standards: Service pages 1,500-2,500 words | Blog posts 1,200-3,000 words | Supporting pages 800-1,500 words

Why It Matters: Thin content doesn't rank in 2026. Comprehensive content that answers all user questions dominates search results.

6. Image Optimization

What We Do: Descriptive, keyword-rich file names, strategic alt text optimization, image compression (WebP format), lazy loading implementation, responsive images

Why It Matters: Optimized images improve page speed and can rank in Google Image Search for additional traffic.

7. Internal Linking Strategy

What We Do: Build hub-and-spoke architecture, create contextual internal links, distribute PageRank strategically, fix orphan pages, add breadcrumb navigation

Why It Matters: Internal linking distributes ranking power and helps Google understand content relationships. Strong internal linking leads to 40% more pages indexed and ranking.

8. URL Optimization

What We Do: Create clean URLs, include target keywords, remove unnecessary stop words, enforce lowercase/hyphen format, fix URL parameter issues

Why It Matters: Clean URLs improve user trust and CTR. They also make your site easier to crawl and index.

9. Content Formatting for Readability

What We Do: Break content into short paragraphs, use bullet points and numbered lists, add bold/italic emphasis, optimize white space, include pull quotes, add table of contents

Why It Matters: Scannable content keeps users on page longer, reducing bounce rate and improving dwell time ‚Äî both ranking signals.

10. Conversion Optimization (CTA Placement)

What We Do: Place strategic CTAs above fold, mid-content, and at page end, write action-oriented CTA copy, design visual CTA buttons, integrate lead magnets, optimize forms

Why It Matters: On-page SEO isn't just about traffic ‚Äî it's about converting that traffic into leads and customers.

How Our On-Page Optimization Process Works

Phase 1: Content Audit (Week 1)

We crawl your site to identify thin content, duplicate content, keyword gaps, title/meta quality, internal linking weaknesses, and readability issues. Deliverable: On-Page SEO Audit Report with page-by-page scoring.

Phase 2: Keyword Research & Mapping (Week 1-2)

Research and map target keywords for every page, analyze search intent, assign keywords to pages, identify content gaps. Deliverable: Complete Keyword Targeting Matrix.

Phase 3: Optimization Implementation (Week 2-6)

Tier 1: Critical pages (homepage, top 5 service pages)
Tier 2: Supporting pages (About, Contact, Case Studies)
Tier 3: Blog archive optimization

Phase 4: Monitoring & Refinement (Ongoing)

Track keyword rankings weekly, monitor organic traffic, analyze user behavior, A/B test titles/descriptions, quarterly content refreshes.

Why LocalCatalyst On-Page SEO Gets Results

We Optimize for Humans AND Algorithms

For Google: Keyword targeting, semantic relevance, technical structure
For Users: Readability, scannability, compelling CTAs
For Conversions: Strategic CTA placement, benefit-driven copy

We Integrate On-Page with Local SEO

We Optimize for AI Overviews (2026 Strategy)

On-Page SEO Pricing

On-Page SEO Audit ‚Äî $1,200

Complete content audit, keyword gap analysis, title/meta review, internal linking analysis, prioritized roadmap. Deliverable: On-Page SEO Audit Report. Timeline: 1 week.

On-Page Optimization Package ‚Äî $3,500

Best for small-mid sites (up to 50 pages). Keyword research, title/meta optimization, header optimization, content expansion (top 10 pages), internal linking strategy, image alt text. Timeline: 4-6 weeks.

Ongoing On-Page SEO Management ‚Äî $1,200/month

Best for blogs and frequently-updated sites. Monthly optimization (4 pages), new page optimization, quarterly keyword updates, A/B testing.

On-Page SEO Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What's the difference between on-page SEO and content marketing?
A: On-page SEO optimizes existing content. Content marketing creates new content. We do both.

Q: How long does it take to see results from on-page SEO?
A: Quick wins like title optimization show in 2-4 weeks. Comprehensive optimization shows full impact within 8-12 weeks.

Q: Can you optimize pages I've already written?
A: Absolutely. We audit and optimize existing content without rewriting from scratch.

Q: Do I need on-page SEO if I have a small site?
A: Yes. Even a 5-page site needs optimized title tags, meta descriptions, and keyword targeting. Small sites often see results faster.

Q: Will on-page SEO improve my conversion rate?
A: Yes. We optimize for conversions: CTA placement, readability, benefit-driven copy.

Get Your Free On-Page SEO Audit
